headline: Pyffr – a simple way to add payments to regular email
description:
Pyffr allows you to add a conditional payment to an email exchange simply by carbon copying @pyffr.com with the amount. For example, to send someone a $20 payment, you just CC: $20@pyffr.com in the email you send them.

Hacker News members get a $10 initial spending credit to try Pyffer. Use the credit to send $5 to a colleague or someone whose work you want to support:

• CC: $5@pyffr.com in an email you send them.

• You'll get an auto-reply from Pyffr with a link to confirm your payment (and you would fund it from the $10 credit you get),

• Your recipient will get an email from Pyffr that your offer is confirmed and the $5 is held in escrow.

• You and and your recipient should CC: $5@pyffr.com as you reply to each other.

• You can close the offer at any time and release the $5 to your recipient.

• Your recipient can withdraw it via PayPal or Venmo.

The overall idea is to facilitate adding a payment to regular email communication (as opposed to just to sending a payment to an email “address” as in PayPal, Zelle, etc.).

https://pyffr.com
